titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ قَالَ يَا رَبِّ يَا رَبِّ
titles.en: Chapter 44 – The one who says, ‘O Lord<sup>azwj</sup>! O Lord<sup>azwj</sup>!’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/208)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ أَيُّوبَ بْنِ الْحُرِّ أَخِي أُدَيْمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَنْ قَالَ عَشْرَ مَرَّاتٍ يَا رَبِّ يَا رَبِّ قِيلَ لَهُ لَبَّيْكَ مَا حَاجَتُكَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ayoub Bin Al Hurr, a brother of Adeym,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who says ten times, ‘O Lord<sup>azwj</sup>! O Lord<sup>azwj</sup>!’, it would be said to him: ‘At your service! What is your need?’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Ayyub ibn al-Hurr brother of ‘Udaym from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “Whoever says ten times, ‘O Lord.’ It will be said to him, “Your call for help is well heard and noted. What kind of help do you need?’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/208)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حُمْرَانَ قَالَ

text: مَرِضَ إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ لَهُ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قُلْ يَا رَبِّ يَا رَبِّ عَشْرَ مَرَّاتٍ فَإِنَّ مَنْ قَالَ ذَلِكَ نُودِيَ لَبَّيْكَ مَا حَاجَتُكَ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad and Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, altogether, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muhammad Bin Humran who said,

‘Ismail, son of Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> fell sick, so Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said him: ‘Say, ‘O Lord<sup>azwj</sup>! O Lord<sup>azwj</sup>!’, ten times, for the one who says that, would be called out: ‘At your service! What is your need?’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ahmad ibn Muhammad and Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father all have narrated from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Muhammad ibn Humran who has said the following: “When Isma’il son of abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) became ill, abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) told him to say, ‘Ten times; O Lord.’ Whoever says this will be called, ‘Your call is heard and well noticed, ask what kind of help do you need?”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/209)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَنْ قَالَ يَا رَبِّ يَا اللَّهُ يَا رَبِّ يَا اللَّهُ حَتَّى يَنْقَطِعَ نَفَسُهُ قِيلَ لَهُ لَبَّيْكَ مَا حَاجَتُكَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Muawiya, from Abu Baseer,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who says, ‘O Lord<sup>azwj</sup>! O Lord<sup>azwj</sup>!’, until his breath is cut off, it would be said to him, ‘At your service! What is your need?’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Mu’awiyah from abu Basir from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “Whoever says, ‘O Lord, O Allah, for one full breath, it is said to him, “Your call is heard and well noticed, ask what kind of help do you need?”’
